intro: Aporum minutigibbum, commonly known as the small-lobed aporum, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, compound leaves with small, rounded lobes. Native to tropical regions of Central and South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
